caseTitle: Saif ur Rehman v. Additional District Judge, etc
tagline: The only possible purposive, beneficial and rational interpretation of Section 14(2) of the Family Courts Act is that the right of appeal of a husband against whom a decree has been passed is curtailed. However, in no event, the right of the wife to file an appeal is extinguished if she is dissatisfied with any decree in a suit for dower or dowry.
